alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 5:02PM EST until January 09 at 11:55AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Lexington and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Saluda, Greenwood and Newberry Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. At 124.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility with some access roads flooded. Extensive farmland flooding occurs in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:26 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 107.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 122.5 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 500 AM EST.
